text: In which procurement management process is the source selection criteria created for your project?
explanation: Source selection criteria is created during the Plan Procurement Management process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 478

choices.text: Conduct Procurements
Control Procurements
Close Project or Phase
Plan Procurement Management

text: Who is responsible to ensure that all procurements meet the needs of the project?
explanation: It is the project management team’s responsibility to make certain that all procurements meet the specific needs of the project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461

choices.text: Project manager
Procurement manager
Project team
Both the project manager and the procurement manager

text: You are managing a construction project. Four sellers have sent proposals as a response to the RFP that the procurement department in your organization sent. You need to gain a more objective understanding of sellers’ capabilities in order to rank their proposals and select the best one. Which technique may best help avoid bias and subjective decisions?
explanation: Weighting system allows the evaluation committee to select the seller by weighting the source according to the selection criteria. The buyer may compare sellers to select the seller who best meets the selection criteria. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 479

choices.text: Independent estimates
Negotiation
Bidder conference
Weighting system

text: Phillip is managing a research and development project. The scope of the project is not clear, he decided to outsource the project work to another company. He agreed with the procurement manager to use the cost plus incentive fee (CPIF) contract. All of the following are true about this type of contract except:
explanation: In cost reimbursable contracts the total cost of the contractual work is unknown at the beginning of the work, as the scope of work is not precisely defined at the beginning. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 472 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: The seller receives all costs of the performed contractual work, in addition to a predetermined incentive fee based upon achieving certain performance objectives.
If the final costs are less or greater than the original estimated costs, then both the buyer and seller share costs from the departures based upon a prengotiated cost-sharing formula.
This type of contracts should be used if the scope of work is expected to change significantly during the execution of the contract.
The total cost of the contract is known and agreed upon before starting the work.

text: You are a project manager for a product development project. You are now evaluating whether to buy or lease an equipment. The daily lease cost is $120, while the cost of purchasing is $7200 investment cost with $30 daily cost. How long will it take the lease cost to equal the purchase cost?
explanation: *All Lease Costs = 120 * D D is number of days All Buy Costs = 7200 + 30 * D 7200 + 30 *D = 120 D 7200 = 120 D – 30 D 7200 = 90 D D = 7200/90 D = 80 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 473 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 65

choices.text: 60 days
80 days
240 days
48 days

text: A project has been initiated in the organization to build new substation. During project planning, the project manager has a meeting with the procurement manager to discuss what are the goods and services that the project might need from outside the organization. In this meeting what should the project manager provide?
explanation: The main goal for any procurement in a project is to transfer risks from buyer to seller. So the project manager must provide an understanding for project risks to ensure that contract terms and conditions transfer all risks from buyer to seller. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 463 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 74–76

choices.text: A procurement management plan and a list of recommended contract types.
Nothing, make-or-buy decision will be done during project executing.
An understanding of the project risks.
A list of recommended potential sellers.

text: Amit is managing a large telecommunication project to install a new mobile network in four cities. Part of the project work is outsourced to a contractor. Midway through the project, the contractor has submitted an invoice for additional work. Amit reviewed the invoice and found that the work billed is already involved in the contracted scope. What should Amit do?
explanation: The project manager needs first to understand the reason behind the extra billed amount. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 494

choices.text: Ask the procurement department to deal with this issue.
Submit a change request to include the extra billed amount.
Meet with the contractor to clarify the reason behind the additional work and review the project scope.
He should reject the invoice.

text: You are a project manager for a large construction project to build a large shopping mall. All the design work will be outsourced to other companies. Your team developed the procurement statement of work (SOW). The procurement team send request for proposal to potential sellers, but the prices they offered are very high. You and the procurement manager agreed that there must be some negotiation with the potential sellers to get fair and reasonable price. Typically, who leads procurement negotiation?
explanation: The negotiation should be led by a member of the procurement team that has the authority to sign contracts. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 488

choices.text: Project manager
Procurement manager
Project sponsor
Both project manager and procurement manager

text: You work for a construction firm which has a long history in construction projects. Your company is bidding on a contract with the government to build a new bridge. Which of the following contract types has the most risk for your company?
explanation: Here you work for the seller not for the buyer. The highest risks for the seller are in FP contracts. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 462 and 471 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: CPIF
T&M
FFP
CPAF

text: Joseph is managing a large industrial project. He and his team decide to outsource the installation work to a more experienced company, because the installation work is very risky. Only one company has submitted a proposal. They organizational policies for selecting a seller states that there must be at least two potential sellers to start bidding process. Which technique should the project manager use to help him expand the potential sellers list?
explanation: Placing advertisements in publications like newspapers or specialty publications, can help in expanding list of potential sellers and it is a tool used during conducting procurement process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 487

choices.text: Bidder conference
Procurement negotiations
Expert judgment
Advertising

text: You are the project manager of an industrial project. Your organization signed a contract with a supplier to provide your project with 15 computers as per your requirements. After one month the procurement manager called you to inform you that the shipment you requested has arrived containing 18 computers. What should you do?
explanation: A contract should clearly state the deliverables and results expected, including any knowledge transfer from the seller to the buyer. Anything not in the contract cannot be legally enforced. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461

choices.text: Issue a change order to change the contract specifications.
Accept the shipment.
Expect to receive a claim from the seller.
Send the shipment back.

text: Antony is managing an industrial project. He has received a poor quality deliverable from one of the suppliers. He requested the supplier to fix the defects he found. Antony wants to ensure that no defects are found in the future deliveries from the supplier. What should he do?
explanation: Contracts require formality, as there is a contract with the supplier, the project manager must ensure first that the quality requirements exist in the contract and then he should ask for an evidence that the requirements are being followed through quality assurance. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 468

choices.text: Review the contract requirements with the supplier and request quality assurance evidence.
Don’t pay for the defective deliverables and pay only for the accepted ones.
Ask the procurement department to address this issue with the supplier.
Hire a team of inspectors to inspect the deliverables from this supplier.

text: Sam is managing a large IT project. Some work of this project will be outsourced to other companies. To solicit proposals from prospective sellers, all of the following documents should be shared with the potential sellers, except:
explanation: For large procurements, the procuring organization may elect to either prepare its own independent estimate or have a cost estimate prepared by an outside professional estimator to serve as a benchmark on proposed responses. It is used internally in the organization and can't be shared with the potential sellers. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 479

choices.text: Procurement statement of work
Request for Proposal (RFP)
Policies of the buyer's organization that may affect the presented sellers' proposals
Independent cost estimates

text: What do you expect when you are submitting an invitation for bid to sellers?
explanation: A bid is a response for invitation for bid. Terms such as bid, tender, or quotation are generally used when the seller selection decision is based on price (as when buying commercial or standard items). Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 477 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 74–75

choices.text: Offers which will differ significantly in solution approach and price.
Offers which are similar enough to allow a selection based on price.
Offers which are not primarily written to win against competition.
General information on a seller’s ability to provide the goods or services.

text: All of the following statements about bidder conference are true except:
explanation: In bidder conference you must meet all prospective sellers together at once, not each one alone. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 487 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 70

choices.text: The buyer should meet each potential seller separately.
Bidder conferences are held prior to proposal submittal.
Bidder conferences are also called contractor conferences, vendor conferences, and pre-bid conferences.
All sellers receive the same procurement documents.

text: Mike is a procurement specialist who has worked before for a construction firm performing plan-driven projects. He has recently joined ABC organization which has a long history of performing change-driven projects. He asks an agile practitioner about the main differences between change-driven and plan-driven contracts. How should the agile practitioner answer his question?
explanation: On agile projects, procurement is challenging since scope details can't be defined in details prior to contract writing. Also the intangible nature of knowledge work products can make it difficult to evaluate and get acceptance. So agile contracts should be designed to accommodate changes as scope may need to be re-prioritized during the project for business purpose. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 77

choices.text: Change-driven contracts should allow scope early completion for business purpose.
Change-driven contracts should be time and material as scope may change, while plan-driven contracts should be fixed price as scope is fixed.
Change-driven contracts should allow scope reprioritization for business purpose.
Agile values customer collaboration over contract negotiation.

text: Which of the following statements is correct regarding inspection and audit during the Control Procurement process?
explanation: An inspection is a structured review of the work being performed by the contractor. This may involve a simple review of the deliverables or an actual physical review of the work itself. While audits are a structured review of the procurement process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498

choices.text: An inspection is a structured review of the work being performed by the contractor, while audits are a structured review of the procurement process.
An inspection is a structured review of the payments done by the buyer, while audits are a structured review of the procurement process.
An inspection is performed by the seller, while audits are performed by the buyer.
An inspection is a structured review of the procurement process, while audits are a structured review of the work being performed by the buyer.

text: Which of the following statements represents a fixed price incentive fee (FPIF) contract?
explanation: To pay only $1,500,000, it is a FFP contract not FPIP. To pay all the costs plus something, it is a CR contract. The only correct answer is to pay a fixed amount plus bonus if a certain criteria is achieved. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 471 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: Pay the costs plus $15,000 for every month the project is finished earlier than July 15.
Pay $1,500,000 plus $15,000 for every designated incremental quality level reached.
Pay all the costs plus a $15,000 fee.

text: You are managing a large construction project. Part of the project work will be outsourced to a subcontractor. A team member asks about your role as a project manager regarding any procurement in your project. What should you tell him?
explanation: The main goal for any procurement in a project is to transfer risks from buyer to seller. So the project manager must provide an understanding for project risks to ensure that contract terms and conditions transfer all risks from buyer to seller. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 463 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 74–76

choices.text: The project manager should tell the procurement manager how the procurement process should be handled.
The project manager should negotiate with the prospective sellers.
The project manager should provide an understanding of the risks of the project.
The project manager should evaluate seller proposals and select the best one.

text: You are a project manager for a large industrial project. To test your product you need a special equipment. You need to decide whether to buy or lease the equipment. The daily lease cost is $150. The cost of purchasing the item is $2,000 investment cost & $50 daily cost. You need to use the item for about 12 days. What should you do?
explanation: lease 12*150 = 1800 < 2000+(12*50). Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 473 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 65

choices.text: Lease it
Consult the sponsor
Buy it
Ask the customer to pay for $2,000 change order

text: Andy is a project manager for a large construction project. All the project work will be outsourced to other subcontractors. Andy is just starting the procurement process. Which of the following should be done last?
explanation: Performing make-or-buy analysis is done firstly during planning process group in the Plan Procurement Management process, then seeking experts judgement and then selecting the contract type. But contract terms and conditions is done later in the Conduct Procurement process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 489 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 74–77

choices.text: Seek expert judgment from a variety of resources.
Select contract type whether FP, T and M or CR.
Perform make-or-buy analysis.
Finalize the terms and conditions of the contract.

text: In which procurement management process is the source selection criteria used in your project?
explanation: Source selection criteria is created during the Plan Procurement Management process and used to select the seller in the Conduct Procurement process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 486

choices.text: Conduct Procurements
Control Procurements
Close Project or Phase
Plan Procurement Management

text: You are a project manager for a $10,000,000 construction project. A part of the project work will be outsourced to subcontractors. The procurement department is now contacting subcontractors to obtain bids and proposals. Which of the following techniques would help you save time because you know that it is a time-consuming procedure to ensure that the sellers get a clear and common understanding of the procurement process and of the needs of your project?
explanation: Bidder conferences are used to ensure that all prospective sellers have a clear and common understanding of the procurement requirements. Also you answer all sellers' questions. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 487 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 70

choices.text: Bidder conferences
Advertising
Qualified sellers list
Proposal evaluation

text: You are a project manager for a large infrastructure project. Your project includes civil, electric and mechanical work. Your organization doesn't have the adequate experience in all these fields, so you will need to outsource some work to more experienced companies. So you need to start with your team planning for procurement management. When during the project life cycle of the project you perform the Plan Procurement Management process?
explanation: This Plan Procurement Management process is performed once or at predefined points in the project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 466

choices.text: At the beginning of the project
Throughout the project life cycle
Once or at pre-defined points in the project
At the beginning of each phase of the project

text: What is the correct name of the seller in the following procurements management processes respectively: Plan Procurement Management, Conduct Procurements and Control Procurements?
explanation: The seller can be viewed during the contract life cycle first as a bidder during the Plan Procurement Management process, then as the selected source during the Conduct Procurements process, and then as the contracted supplier or vendor during the Control Procurements process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461

choices.text: Potential seller, contracted supplier and selected source
Selected bidder, potential vendor and contracted supplier
Selected seller, potential seller and contracted vendor
Bidder, selected source and contracted supplier

text: Frank is a project manager for a large construction project. During project execution, he faces shortage in some raw material which is urgently needed, as the project might face delays if these material are not available within one week. This might lead to missing important milestones and the project will be subjected to financial penalties. Following the internal procurement process will take more time. A supplier has submitted an offer to provide the needed raw material and reimburse the cost later, however the cost is very high. Which of the following should Frank do? (1) Submit change request with extra budget. (2) Update the procurement strategy. (3) Negotiate with the supplier. (4) Reject the offer and escalate to procurement department. (5) Update the procurement management plan.
explanation: The objective of the procurement strategy is to determine the project delivery method, the type of legally binding agreement(s), and how the procurement will advance through the procurement phases. The project manager should negotiate with the supplier to get less price and update the procurement strategy to allow faster delivery methods. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 476

text: Which of the following is the best thing to do at bidder conference?
explanation: If sellers' questions aren't asked, it adds risks. These conferences are used to ensure that all prospective bidders have a clear and common understanding of the procurement. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 487 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 70

choices.text: Make sure the sellers have all the procurement documents.
Meet with each seller separately.
Answer sellers' questions.
Make sure the sellers ask all their questions.

text: Your organization is a bidder in a new office building project and you are assigned to prepare the bidding documents for this project. Your organization will provide furniture for the buyer. You need to know more details about the specifications of the needed furniture because the statement of work which the buyer sent is not detailed enough. Which document will you send to the buyer in this situation?
explanation: An RFI is used when more information on the goods and services to be acquired is needed from the sellers. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 477 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 192

choices.text: Procurement statement of work (SOW)
Request for proposal (RFP)
Request for quotation (RFQ)
Request for information (RFI)

text: You are a project manager for a large construction project. You are searching for a supplier to provide some raw material for your project. You asked your team to prepare all the needed information on the types, quantities and specifications of the needed raw material. When will you send him a RFQ?
explanation: The procurement management process must be performed with the correct sequence. You must first plan for procurement management and perform make or buy analysis to know if you will buy or make what you need, then create procurement SOW and procurement documents and send them to all prospective sellers. Then you can select a seller. So you will send an RFQ to seller after creating the procurement documents but before selecting a seller. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 477 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 192

choices.text: After you create the procurement documents, but before you select the seller.
Before signing the contract, but after selecting the seller.
After the bidder conference, but before you select the seller.
After making make-or-buy analysis and before taking make-or-buy decision.

text: Carol is the project manager for a new engineering project. Some of the project work will be contracted to another company. She is discussing with the procurement manager about the appropriate contract type for the contracted work. Which of the following is the most important aspect to consider in determining the contract type?
explanation: What best determines contract type is the completeness of procurement statement of work. If SOW is detailed enough you can select FP contracts which has least risks for the buyer. But if the procurement SOW is incomplete, you can select CR or T&M contracts and accept higher risks for the buyer. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 471–472 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: The completeness of the procurement statement of work.
The cost of the contracted work.
The team experience of dealing with which types of contracts.
The available lessons learned in the organization about working with different contract types.

text: Sam is a project manager for a project to design a car parking sensor. He has a limited scope definition and he wants to protect his company from financial risk. The design work will be outsourced to another company. Which type of contract should he choose for his project?
explanation: Here you can't choose FFP as you have limited scope. You should select CR contract as you have limited scope and of course CPFF is better than CPAF because in CPAF the buyer has higher risk than CPFF, because the buyer will pay more to the seller. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 472 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: Cost plus award fee (CPAF)
Time and Material (T&M)
Cost plus fixed fee (CPFF)
Firm Fixed price (FFP)

text: All of the following statements describe the focus of the Plan Procurement Management process, except:
explanation: The focus of procurement management is to acquire goods and services from outside the project only. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 466

choices.text: Whether to acquire goods and services from outside the project.
What goods and services will be acquired from outside the project.
How and when to acquire goods and services from outside the project.
Whether to acquire goods and services from inside and outside the project, what to acquire, as well as how and when to acquire them.

text: All of the following statements are true about procurement inspection, except:
explanation: An inspection is a structured review of the work being performed by the contractor. This may involve a simple review of the deliverables or an actual physical review of the work itself. On a construction/engineering/infrastructure project, inspections involve walkthroughs of the site by both the buyer and the contractor to ensure a mutual understanding of the work in progress. An audit is a structured review of the procurement process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498

choices.text: An inspection is a structured review of the work being performed by the contractor.
An inspection may involve a walkthroughs of the site by both the buyer and the contractor.
An inspection may involve a simple review of the deliverables or an actual physical review of the work itself.
An inspection is a structured review of the procurement process.

text: John is managing a product development project. He and his team decide to outsource part of the project work to another company. They have completed the procurement statement of work. Technical details of the outsourced work are set precisely in addition to the required quality levels. The procurement team want to select the contract type. Which contract type is the most appropriate in this situation?
explanation: Since the procurement statement of work is precisely defined and future cost risks should be avoided, then the most suitable contract type is FFP Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 471 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: Time and material (T & M)
Fixed price- economic price adjustment (FP-EPA)
Firm fixed price (FFP)
Cost plus fixed fee (CPFF)

text: After the prospective sellers have submitted proposals, the engineering manager is arguing with the finance manager about which seller should award the contract. The engineering manager wants the contract to be awarded to seller A because this seller has great experience with the work to be performed. While the finance manager says that the contract should be awarded to seller B, because he will provide the required work with low cost. The project manager should tell them to best focus on which document to make the selection:
explanation: Source selection criteria is the document which determines how to select a seller. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 478 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 75

choices.text: Procurement strategy
Source selection criteria
Procurement statement of work
Procurement management plan

text: Jenny is the project manager for an electronic boards design project in a multi-national organization. She needs a supplier to provide the electronic components needed for her project. A contract should be signed with the supplier to provide the needed components on time with the required specifications. Typically, who should sign the contract with the supplier?
explanation: The project manager is typically not authorized to sign legal agreements binding the organization; this is reserved for those who have the authority to do so (the procurement manager). Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 460

choices.text: Project manager
Procurement manager
Project sponsor
Both the project manager and the procurement manager

text: Which of the following statements is true?
explanation: A complex project may involve managing multiple contracts simultaneously or in sequence. In such cases, each contract life cycle may begin and end during any phase of the project life cycle. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 75

choices.text: A. A complex project may involve managing multiple contracts.
B. A complex contract may involve managing multiple projects.
C. A project can involve only one contract.
D. A contract can involve only one project.

text: Mark is a project manager for an industrial project. He is involved in a fixed-price (FP) contract with a supplier, which of the following might not be an output of the Control Procurement process?
explanation: Resource change approvals are not needed in fixed price contracts. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 471 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: A. Resource change approvals
B. Payment requests
C. Change requests
D. Lessons learned register updates

text: The procurement claims are monitored and managed throughout the contract life cycle in accordance with:
explanation: Procurement claims (or disputes or appeals) are documented, processed, monitored, and managed throughout the contract life cycle, usually in accordance with the terms of the contract. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498

choices.text: A. The procurement management plan
B. The procurement statement of work
C. The contracts terms and conditions
D. The bid documents

text: Your software project is halfway done, when one of the key stakeholders submitted a change request to add a major work package. You evaluated the impacts of the change and found that the change will need to add 10,000$ to the cost baseline and two more weeks to the critical path, or you can crash the extra two weeks by hiring two web developers to perform the added work with extra cost of 5,000$. The change is submitted to the change control board and finally approved to add the extra work without increasing the project duration. You need to hire the two web developers immediately, which type of contracts is most appropriate in this situation?
explanation: Time and material contracts are often used for staff augmentation, acquisition of experts, and any outside support when a precise statement of work cannot be quickly prescribed. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 472 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: A. Cost plus fixed fee (CPFF)
B. Time and material (T & M)
C. Firm fixed price (FFP)
D. Cost plus incentive fee (CPIF)

text: During which process the request for quotation (RFQ) is sent to potential sellers?
explanation: The request of quotation (RFQ) is part of the procurement documents that are created during the procurement planning process and sent to potential sellers during the Conduct Procurement process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 485

choices.text: A. Plan Procurements Management
B. Conduct Procurements
C. Control Procurements
D. Direct and Manage Project Work

text: A cyber security project is being implemented to protect ABC company's data. During project execution, a new law is being discussed which requires additional protection for the user's information. This will require additional security features to be added which were not part of the original scope. What should the project manager do in this situation?
explanation: The law has not yet been applied, but there is a risk that new requirements will be added to the project scope to comply with the new law. So, the best answer is to add a risk for the new requirements that might emerge as a result of the new law and develop a response plan. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 27

choices.text: Hold a meeting with the legal department to learn about the new requirements.
Raise a change request to include the new needed features for additional data protection.
Do nothing until the law is applied.
Add a risk to the risk log and develop a response plan.

text: You are managing a construction project which contains a procurement work. The air conditioning system of the project will be outsourced to a contractor. You prepare the RFP to be sent to contractors when your cousin knows that you will need a contractor. He owns a company working in air conditioning system and he wants to bid on your project. The reputation of his company is very good and your company worked with him before and he's done good work. What should you do?
explanation: When bidders are competing for a contract, you must make sure that no bidders receive preferential treatment. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 487

choices.text: You disclose the conflict of interest to your company, and disqualify your cousin’s company.
You disclose the conflict of interest to your company, and remove yourself from the selection committee.
You disclose the conflict of interest to your company, and provide your cousin with information that the other bidders don’t have so that he has a better chance of winning the contract.
You do not disclose the conflict of interest, and give your cousin the bid.

text: Sam is a project manager for a product development project. He is managing his first project. He has finalized the schedule of his project and added all working and non-working days and team vacations on it. He realized that there will be overlapping vacations between his team and the quality control team who will test the product of the project. There will be no one to test the product. Which type of constraints that causes the problem here?
explanation: The constraint here is a resource constraint because the resources will not be available when the project manager needs them. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 10 and 28 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 174

choices.text: Quality constraint
Time constraint
Resource constraint
Risk constraint

text: Peter is the project manager for an industrial project. The design work of his project is outsourced to another company under a contract. When can he use formal written correspondence with this company?
explanation: The procurement management process is a formal process. All communications must be formal written when there is a change to document the change and sign it from both parties. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 496 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: When he needs information from the company.
When there is conversation with the company.
When there is a meeting with the company's management.
When there is a change to the procurement statement of work.

text: Gary is managing a large tele-communications project. The installation work will be outsources to another company. After the prospective sellers have been identified and received the procurement documents, Gary invites the sellers to attend a bidder conference. What should he do?
explanation: The procurement management process requires formality. Ensuring that all prospective sellers got the same information in writing ensures that there is no bias from the project manager to any of them. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 489 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 70

choices.text: To hold separate meetings with each bidder.
All questions and answers are put in writing and sent to all sellers.
All sellers get answers to their questions only.
Negotiate with the potential sellers to get the least possible price.

text: A sub-contractor in your project went out of business and you need to start construction tomorrow to meet the next milestone date. Which type of contract would you sign with the new sub-contractor?
explanation: Time and material contracts are the fastest and easiest in negotiation. As you don't have time to negotiate a new contract, it is better to select a time and material contract. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 472 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 191

choices.text: Time and Material (T & M)
Cost plus fixed fee (CPFF)
Cost plus incentive fee (CPIF)
Firm Fixed Price (FFP)

text: Mark is managing a project to prepare a chemical compound. During project executing, a senior manager has requested from Mark the data sheet of one of the chemical components used to prepare the chemical compound. The senior manager is not authorized to see this data but he insists to see it. What should Mark do in this situation?
explanation: As the senior manager is not authorized to see this data, so the project manager must ensure compliance. He should meet the senior manager as soon as possible to discuss the matter further with him and know the exact reason for getting this data. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 27

choices.text: Provide the needed data sheet to the senior manager.
Have a meeting with the senior manager to discuss this topic.
Escalate this topic to the project steering committee.
Ask the project sponsor to take the responsibility of senior management engagement.

text: Monica is leading a project to develop a new electronic device in predictive environment. She discusses with the project team using a new component suggested by a team member to have better performance. The project team needs to test the viability of using the new component. They have a tight schedule and there is a risk if they decide to use the new component and it turns out later that it affects the product performance, the project will face delays and financial penalties. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: Incorporating agile methods with traditional methods would make the overall project management approach hybrid. In this situation, the project team could use the agile technique of a spike. Spikes are useful for learning and may be used in circumstances such as: estimation, acceptance criteria definition, addressing a risk, and understanding the flow of a user’s action through the product. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide, Page 56

choices.text: Discuss this issue with the sponsor.
Hold a spike.
Plan for a contingency reserve.
Use the new component.

text: Who is responsible to ensure that organizational procurement policies are followed?
explanation: It is the project management team’s responsibility to make certain that all procurements meet the specific needs of the project while working with the procurement office to ensure organizational procurement policies are followed. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461

choices.text: Project manager
Procurement office
Project management team
Both project management team and procurement office

text: The project manager has just communicated the responsibility assignment matrix to the project team. A team member who has just been assigned to the project finds that he is involved with three team members in a procurement audit. He asks the project manager about the purpose of the procurement audit. The project manager told him that the purpose of the procurement audit is to:
explanation: Audits are a structured review of the procurement process. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 79

choices.text: Review the work being performed by the contractor.
Review the type of the selected contract.
Review the contract cost.
Review the procurement process.

text: Documenting the questions and answers in a bidder conference and sending them to all bidders is an example of which kind of communication?
explanation: Anytime you have any communication having to do with bidding, it’s always formal written. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 485-487 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 70

choices.text: Informal verbal
Formal written
Formal verbal
Informal written

text: You are a project manager for an industrial project. You are analyzing with the sponsor and project team members whether to do part of the project by your company or outsource this part to another company. Finally you all agree to do the work by your company because:
explanation: This is an example of make or buy analysis. You can decide to buy to transfer risks to the seller. And you can decide to make if the project contains proprietary data. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 473 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 65

choices.text: Your company has limited resources.
Your company doesn't want to have control over the work.
There is a lot of proprietary data.
Your company doesn't have experienced manpower.

text: Prior to the iteration review, after the team has completed all the story points in the iteration backlog, a new industry standard has been released and the performing organization must comply with it. Accordingly, the product increment launch will not be done as planned. Which of the following is the best course of action to realize benefits?
explanation: They should review the target benefits first which will be impacted by the new standard. Understanding the organization and the industry requirements that an organization needs to satisfy allows for choosing the right conversations, the right tradeoffs, and, especially, the right techniques. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide, Page 76

choices.text: Extend current iteration to add the new standard requirements.
Review target benefits.
Release the current product increment without adding the standard requirements and add it after product demo.
Increase the team velocity to add the new requirement to the current iteration.

text: A project has been initiated several months ago to build a new factory. The project has been postponed several times due to non-compliance with environmental codes required by local laws in the country where the project is being performed. A new project manager has been assigned to this project. What should the new project manager do to move forward and have this project completed?
explanation: Projects must comply with laws, rules, regulations, and requirements that are properly authorized within or outside of their organization. However, high-performing projects seek ways to integrate compliance more fully into the project culture, creating more alignment with diverse and potentially conflicting guidelines. So, the best approach is to include environmental compliance requirements in the project scope. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 27

choices.text: Meet with the city council representatives, explain to them the project objectives and the benefits of building this factory to the city.
Include environmental compliance requirements in the project scope, identify risks to achieving these requirements and develop responses.
Consult lessons learned collected by previous project managers, include enough cost and schedule reserves to accommodate for any further delays or penalties.
Descope the non-compliant requirements to move forward.

text: A small project has been initiated in ABC organization which is known to be working on mega projects. The organization adopts waterfall approach for all projects and has strict project management processes. The new project team consists of four colocated team members. The project manager decides not to create some artifacts like communication management plan, meeting minutes, stakeholders engagement plan and quality management plan. Which of the following best describes what the project manager is doing?
explanation: Tailoring is the deliberate adaptation of the project management approach, governance, and processes to make them more suitable for the given environment and the work at hand. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 131

choices.text: Violating the PMI processes
Tailoring
Noncompliance
Creating new approach

text: A Value Delivery Office (VDO) most probably exists in which of the following organizations?
explanation: A VDO may be found in organizations that use more adaptive delivery approaches. Only Scrum is adaptive approach all others are predictive approaches. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 141

choices.text: DEF organization which is specialized in large mechanical projects which require much up front planning.
UVW organization which adopts Scrum methodology in all its projects.
ABC construction firm which adheres to waterfall approach in all its projects.
XYZ organization which is specialized in safety critical projects.

text: A project team is working on a project to build a part of a nuclear reactor using waterfall development approach. The project team wants to tailor some processes related to reporting and communication by removing some activities which seem to be not necessary. The performing organization senior management object to this tailoring approach and added additional approval layer for the project team before changing any process. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: Additional constraints for tailoring for the organization include large, safety-critical projects. Large, safety-critical project tailoring suggestions may require additional oversight and approval to help prevent errors, loss, or subsequent issues. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 139

choices.text: Tailoring the project documents or processes should be the project team decision not the senior management decision.
The project senior management are overstepping their role.
Tailoring any project documents or processes should be agreed with the senior management in advance.
This project has tailoring constraints.

text: A project is being implemented in an organization to prepare a chemical compound and it is required to follow strict regulatory compliance guidelines. The project manager wants to ensure adherence to these guidelines as they are mandatory requirements for the project. What should the project manager do?
explanation: Adherence to regulatory compliance is a requirement, it must be managed as part of the project scope and not as best effort. The best answer is to assign this requirement to team member. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 27

choices.text: Assign a team member as responsible to ensure regulatory compliance and update RACI matrix accordingly.
Check regulatory compliance adherence during project closure.
Submit a change request to allocate enough time, cost and resources to accommodate regulatory compliance.
Manage adherence to regulatory compliance as best effort according to available time, budget and resources.

text: A new project has been initiated in XYZ organization. The organization has its internal governance system which states that each project must pass through five approval gates from initiation to closure. In order to have gate 2 approved, the project team must provide a project management plan including scope, schedule and cost baselines. The project team objects to this approach and decides that they will use adaptive approach which is more suitable and tailored to the project needs. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: Organizations that have established process governance need to ensure tailoring is aligned to policy. To demonstrate that the project team’s tailoring decisions do not threaten the organization’s larger strategic or stewardship goals, project teams may need to justify using a tailored approach. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 139

choices.text: The organization should follow the project team's tailored approach.
The project team should follow the organization's governance system.
The organization should exclude this project from internal governance system.
Let the customer decide which development approach to adopt.

text: An organization has signed a contract with the customer to develop a new mobile application. The customer has stated in the contract that there are milestones to be approved by the customer like creating the project charter, approving the project management plan, approving the demo version,..etc. The project team assigned from the performing organization need to use iterative approach because it is more tailored to the project needs, which may lead to missing some of these milestones. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: Additional constraints for tailoring for the organization include projects performed under contract. Projects that are performed under contract may have contract terms that specify the use of a particular life cycle, delivery approach, or methodology. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 139

choices.text: Follow the contract.
Use hybrid approach as a compromise.
Use iterative approach.
Reject the project assignment.

text: During executing a project to produce a new pharmaceutical compound, an industry standard has been issued by the government which takes an immediate effect. The new standard may require audits on the project to ensure project compliance. The audit may be performed at any time throught the project. The audit might have a negative impact on the project like re-work, auditors might find inconsistencies and disrupting the project management plan. What is the best way to handle these audits?
explanation: Incorporating agile methods with traditional methods would make the overall project management approach hybrid. In this situation, the project team could use the agile technique of a spike. Spikes are useful for learning and may be used in circumstances such as: estimation, acceptance criteria definition, addressing a risk, and understanding the flow of a user’s action through the product. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide, Page 56

choices.text: As unplanned spike.
Ask the sponsor to postpone these audits.
Inform stakeholders that the project may not achieve its objectives.
Accommodate audit impacts from management reserve.

text: You are a project manager for a product development project. You have recently received a shipment for your project containing barcode scanners. The shipment contains twenty pieces of barcode scanners, while the contract states that the seller should provide twenty five pieces. You find that twenty pieces can satisfy the needs of your project. What is the best course of action?
explanation: Contracts must be formal. If there is a clause in the contract, it is binding for both parties. If there is a shipment which does not meet the requirements of the contract, it should not be received. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 75

choices.text: Send the shipment back to the seller.
Accept the shipment.
Issue a change order to change the contract specifications.
Deduct the cost difference from the next payment to the seller.

text: All of the following statements describe the focus of the contract review and approval process, except:
explanation: The primary focus of the review and approval process is to ensure that the contract adequately describes the products, services, or results that the seller is agreeing to provide, while being in compliance with the laws and regulations regarding procurements. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 461

choices.text: To ensure that the contract adequately describes the products, services, or results that the seller will provide.
To ensure that the procurement office got the least possible price from the prospective sellers.
To ensure that the contract is in compliance with the laws in the country where the project is being performed.
To ensure that the contract is in compliance with the organization's procurements regulations and policies.

text: Bill is the project manager for a construction project that is building a new branch for his company. When the project first started, he met with the stakeholders to define the scope. The CEO of the company will attend the ceremony to open the new branch. Bill was informed by his manager that he has a deadline to finish the new branch in ten months. This deadline is considered as a:
explanation: Deadline is a project constraint. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 28

choices.text: Project Schedule
Project Objective
Project Constraint
Project Assumption

text: Kim is assigned to manage a new project to build a new electric substation that is part of an electric utility program to serve a new industrial park. The program management plan states that all changes to any project within the program exceeding 2% of the project budget should be approved by the program manager and other changes less than 2% of the project budget to be approved by change control board. Kim is developing the project management plan with this team, he thinks that most of the change requests affecting the budget may exceed 2% of the project budget. So, most of the changes will need the program manager approval. So, he wants to make the changes exceeding 5% of the project budget to be approved by the program manager, and other changes less than 5% to be approved by change control board. Which of the following statements is correct regarding Kim's opinion?
explanation: Projects that exist in the context of a program or portofolio should develop a project management plan that is consistent with the program or portfolio management plan. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 83 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66

choices.text: Kim's opinion is not correct. Projects that exist in the context of a program should develop a project management plan that is consistent with the program management plan.
Kim is right, he is the project manager and he is accountable for project success.
Kim can discuss with the program manager and find a compromise that satisfy both parties.
Kim should escalate this issue to the project sponsor.

text: Carol is managing a network installation project for a customer that is part of a program. The new network should be installed in 50 different sites located in the same country. She provides a weekly report containing the RAG status of each site to the customer. The customer has drilled through the details of each site behind marked as red or amber and finds that for the same reasons some sites are marked as red and some are marked as amber. Which of the following best describes the issue and the resolution?
explanation: Ambiguity is a state of being unclear, having difficulty in identifying the cause of events, or having multiple options from which to choose. The situation here involves an ambiguity category known as conceptual ambiguity- the lack of effective understanding—occurs when people use similar terms or arguments in different ways. Ambiguity of this type can be reduced by formally establishing common rules and definitions of terms. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 117

choices.text: It is conceptual ambiguity and it can be reduced by formally establishing common definitions of terms.
It is situational ambiguity and it can be reduced by formally establishing common definitions of terms.
It is conceptual ambiguity and it can be reduced by progressive elaboration.
It is situational ambiguity and it can be reduced by progressive elaboration.

text: Which of the following situations entails high volatility?
explanation: Volatility exists in an environment that is subject to rapid and unpredictable change. Volatility can occur when there are ongoing fluctuations in available skill sets or materials. Volatility usually impacts cost and schedule. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 122

choices.text: The project team members have never worked on this type of projects before and they lack understanding and awareness about the product of the project.
We have many options and we are not sure which one we can undertake. We need to wait sometime till more information evolves.
It was a tough challenge to link the organization's ticketing system to the customer’s systems due to unpredicted systems behavior.
The customer requested many alternatives to the initially stated requirements which has ended up with a product totally different than the agreed one at the beginning of the project.

text: A government agency contracts with ABC company for development of a new software. The development team consists of project team members from both organizations. The project team members have assumptions, ways of working, and mental models related to how they function within their home organization. In this new project system, which combines the cultures of ABC company and the government agency, what can the project team do to engage, contribute effectively and help to increase the probability that the project system works?
explanation: The project system often brings together a diverse project team engaged in working for a common objective. This diversity brings value to project teams, but they need to consider how to leverage those differences effectively, so that the project team works cohesively. In this new project system, which combines the cultures of two organizations, the project team members can establish a synthesized team culture that creates a common vision, language, and toolset. This can help project team members to engage and contribute effectively and help to increase the probability that the project system works. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 38

choices.text: The project team should mention all the requirements regarding engagement, culture and ways of working in the contract between both organizations.
The project team members can establish a synthesized team culture that creates a common vision, language, and toolset.
The project team from both organizations should work in one common place to enhance communication.
The government agency can enforce their culture and ways of working as they are the customer for this project.

text: You have been working on a construction project for 5 months. The project is on schedule and budget when one of the functional managers tells you the resources committed to the project are no longer available. They will join another project. The new project isn’t critical, but the project manager is the brother of a board member. What is the best course of action in this situation?
explanation: It is the responsibility of the PMO to officially prioritize projects in organizations. While determining when resources become available is not a proactive solution. Using reserves is for identified risks only. Negotiating a new schedule is not a good solution. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 48

choices.text: Negotiate a new schedule with the other project manager.
Use the reserve to hire contractors to complete the work.
Determine when resources will become available.
Ask the PMO to formally prioritize projects.

text: Adam is a manager in his organization, he is responsible for ensuring that maintenance work is running efficiently and smoothly. Gerard is also a manager in the same organization, he is responsible for providing management oversight for maintenance work in the organization. Stephen is also a manager in the same organization, he is responsible for leading his team to ensure that the new testing station is installed and working properly within predetermined schedule and budget. Which of the following statements best describes their roles?
explanation: The functional manager focuses on providing management oversight for a functional or business unit. Operations managers are responsible for ensuring that business operations are efficient. The project manager is the person assigned by the performing organization to lead the team that is responsible for achieving the project objectives. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 52

choices.text: Adam is a functional manager, Gerard is an operations manager and Stephen is a project manager.
Adam is an operations manager, Gerard is a functional manager and Stephen is a project manager.
Adam is a project manager, Gerard is a functional manager and Stephen is an operations manager.
Adam is an operations manager, Gerard is a project manager and Stephen is a functional manager.

text: A petroleum company is investing in a series of initiatives to look for petroleum in many countries so that the company can be competitive in 5 years. The initiatives are tracked and managed together because this goal is very important to the success of the company. This is an example of:
explanation: A portfolio is a group of projects, programs and operational work which have a common strategic goal and here is one startegc goal which is that the company becomes competitive in 5 years. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 11 and The Standard for Project Management, Page 4

choices.text: A portfolio
A program
A project
An enterprise environmental factor

text: Catherine is a new project manager in a construction firm. She is attending a project management webinar about the importance of strategic and business management skills for a project manager. The trainer indicated many reasons for the project manager to be knowledgeable enough about the business, which of the following can't be one of them?
explanation: Technical project management skills not strategic and business management skills are needed by the project manager to be able to achieve project objectives like scope, time and cost. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 58

choices.text: To be able to explain to others the essential business aspects of a project.
To be able to work with the project sponsor, team, and subject matter experts to develop an appropriate project delivery strategy.
To be able to implement that strategy in a way that maximizes the business value of the project.
To be able to achieve project objectives like scope, time and cost.

text: A project has been initiated in ABC organization to develop a new electronic device. The project entails high uncertainty because this is the first time to develop this device. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: Sometimes uncertainty can be reduced by finding out more information, such as conducting research, engaging experts, or performing a market analysis. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 119

choices.text: The project team should use well-designed experiments to reduce the amount of uncertainty.
The project team should use waterfall development approach, because it entails extensive risk management processes.
The project team should gather more information by conducting market analysis.
The project team should plan for enough contingency reserve to accommodate budget overruns.

text: A project has been initiated in an organization to produce a new electric device. Midway through the project, a global shortage for one of the electric components used in the device has occurred. The project team has investigated many approaches to resolve this issue and came up with three possible options. They want to select the best option. This situation represents:
explanation: Situational ambiguity surfaces when more than one outcome is possible. Having multiple options to solve a problem is a form of situational ambiguity. Solutions for exploration of ambiguity include progressive elaboration, experimentation, and the use of prototypes. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 117

choices.text: Volatility
Uncertainty
Conceptual Ambiguity
Situational Ambiguity

text: A large IT project has been initiated in an organization. The project team has created the project management plan and holds a kick-off meeting to get approval from key stakeholders in order to start executing the project activities. The Value Delivery Office (VDO) objects to some parts of the project management plan as the project team postponed the engagement of finance department to a late time in the project, however they should be engaged earlier as per VDO point of view. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: Tailoring that only impacts the project team (e.g., when they hold internal meetings, who works where, etc.) requires less oversight than tailoring that impacts external groups (e.g., how and when other departments are engaged, etc.). Therefore, internal project [details can be decided by the PM, but changes affecting external groups may require PMO or VDO approval].

choices.text: Consult the finance department when they would like to be engaged in the project.
Escalate this topic to the project sponsor.
VDO feedback should be considered.
It's a project team decision.

text: Mark is a project manager in a construction company. He is managing a construction project to build a hospital in a new city. He was informed that a new water line is being installed in the neighborhood beside the hospital under construction. Organizational policy requires that some forms for city environmental changes need to be filled out before his team can continue work on the project. This is an example of:
explanation: As the project manager fills a form required by organizational policy, so this is a good example for an enterprise environmental factor. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 38

choices.text: An organizational process asset
A program
An enterprise environmental factor
A project

text: An IT project has been initiated in XYZ organization. The project is facing high complexity due to linking the organization system to the customer system. The two systems are very complex and the project team can't make accurate predections about the likelihoodof potential outcome. Which of the following might help the project team in this situation?
explanation: Working with complexity that is systems based include decoupling. Decoupling entails disconnecting parts of the system to both simplify the system and reduce the number of connected variables. Determining how a piece of a system works on its own reduces the overall size of the problem. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 121

choices.text: Prototypes
Add contingency reserve
Decoupling
Progressive elaboration

text: Catherine is a procurement specialist. She always prefers to work in a centralized contracting environment than working in a decentralized contracting environment. Which of the following statements best describes the reason behind this?
explanation: In centralized contracting environment, there is a dedicated procurement department, but in decentralized contracting environment there is a procurement specialist for each project. In centralized contracting environment, the procurement specialist will have access to others with similar expertise so she will gain more experience. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 462

choices.text: Because in a centralized contracting environment she will gain more experience.
Because in a centralized contracting environment she will have more loyalty to the project than in a decentralized contracting.
Because in a centralized contracting environment she will report directly to the project manager.
Because startup companies use centralized contracting and the opportunity to grow in these companies is high.

text: The project manager with the project team are completing WBS for the new construction project. There are more than 300 persons in the meeting representing 5 departments. Too many people are talking about later issues while earlier issues are being discussed. The session is hard to manage. What best describes the real problem?
explanation: The project sponsor is not responsible for creating WBS. Stakeholder Management Plan purpose is to detect the engagement levels of stakeholders. The communication management plan has not been created yet to be followed. The best answer is that the project manager here is managing a program. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 14 and The Standard for Project Management, Page 4

choices.text: The project manager didn’t create stakeholders engagement plan.
The project sponsor should be leading this kind of meetings.
The project manager is really managing a program.
The communications management plan isn’t being followed.

text: A project team has been assigned to perform a product development project. The project team members have never worked on this type of projects before and they lack understanding and awareness about the product of the project. This project is characterized as:
explanation: Uncertainty is a lack of understanding and awareness of issues, events, paths to follow, or solutions to pursue. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 117

choices.text: High Volatility
High Uncertainty
High Ambiguity
High Complexity

text: An organization has started a project to produce a wireless headset for a customer. The project was planned to be completed within 6 months using an adaptive approach. The customer has requested adding four more features which has ended up with a product totally different than the agreed one at the beginning of the project. This project has high:
explanation: Volatility exists in an environment that is subject to rapid and unpredictable change. Volatility can occur when there are ongoing fluctuations in available skill sets or materials. Volatility usually impacts cost and schedule. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 122

choices.text: Volatility
Uncertainty
Ambiguity
Complexity

text: During weekly project status meeting, the project manager demonstrates the project progress and status to the key stakeholders. The financial manager asks him whether the next deliverable will be delivered on time in order not to miss the next milestone payment, he answered him "all the project team are doing their best". This situation indicates:
explanation: Ambiguity is a state of being unclear, having difficulty in identifying the c ause of events, or having multiple options from which to choose. The situation here involves an ambiguity category known as conceptual ambiguity- the lack of effective understanding—occurs when people use similar terms or arguments in different ways. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 117

choices.text: Servant Leadership
Committed Project Team
High Ambiguity
High Performing Team

text: Albert is managing an IT project for a multi-national organization. The project involves replacing the old intra-network with a new one. The project is now near completion. The project sponsor wants to ensure smooth transition to operations and ensure good support to the customer after project delivery. What should Albert do?
explanation: Project closure/transition involves knowledge sharing and transfer from project to operation to ensure proper support. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Ensure that knowledge is properly transferred to the operations team.
Assign one of the project team members to the operations team.
Ensure that all needed information exist in the customer operations manual.

text: The twelvth principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: "At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly". Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: Agile methods employ frequent lookbacks, called “retrospectives,” to reflect on how things are working on the project and identify opportunities for improvements. choices.text: User story
Servant Leadership
Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Retrospectives

text: The construction manager complains that the project didn’t increase his team’s knowledge of AutoCAD and So, the project is not complete. The customer has formally accepted the project. All stated requirements have been met and there is no evidence that learning AutoCAD was a requirement. The project manager should:
explanation: Formal acceptance of the product and satisfying all documented requirements means end of project work and beginning of project closure. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Close the project.
Re-plan the project to include the new requirement.
Meet with the construction manager to help resolve the issue.
Meet with the team to discuss the issue and find a solution.

text: You are the project manager for a construction project. The project is ahead of schedule and over budget and there are 45 human resources working in the project. The sponsor pulls the plug and cancels the project. What should you do?
explanation: Even if the project is terminated, it must be closed. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Give the team the day off till you discuss with the sponsor.
Create a budget summary for the remaining unspent budget.
Follow project closure procedures to close the project.
Find new assignments for any people previously assigned to your project.

text: During project closure, a project manager performs activities related to satisfy completion of project or phase and activities related to the completion of contract or agreement. Which of the following are involved in both activities?
explanation: Confirmation that the product is accepted is involved in both activities which are related to satisfy completion of project or phase and activities related to the completion of contract or agreement. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Confirmation that the product is accepted
Finalizing open claims
Reassigning personnel
Dealing with excess project material

text: The finance manager has contacted the project manager asking him that the billing process of the project has not been triggered yet. As per the organization policy, once the customer accepts the deliverables, the project should be closed on the organization internal tools and billing process starts. The project manager has responded that this project has been completed and he is now assigned to another project. Which of the following might be the root cause for this situation?
explanation: The activities necessary for the administrative closure of the project or phase include making certain that all documents and deliverables are up-to-date and that all issues are resolved; Confirming the delivery and formal acceptance of deliverables by the customer; Ensuring that all costs are charged to the project; Closing project accounts;..etc. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: It was an agile project, so there is no project closure process.
The project is still in transition phase.
The project manager did not perform administrative project closure.
Triggering billing is a financial task, the financial manager should do it himself.

text: Dennis is a project manager for a four phases sequential industrial project. He has scheduled a meeting with concerned stakeholders to hand-off phase product and to evaluate the project performance compared to the project and business documents. This activity can be referred to all the following terms except:
explanation: Phase gates may be referred to by other terms such as, phase review, stage gate, kill point, and phase entrance or phase exit. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 21

choices.text: Stage gate
Phase review
Kill point
Transition phase

text: You are managing a project to install a new intra-network for a customer. The project work has been completed and the deliverables were handed over to the customer. You have closed all open claims, shared the final project report, updated the lessons learned repository, closed all procurements and obtained a final acceptance from the customer for the project deliverables. What should you do next?
explanation: Activities needed to transfer the project's products, services, or results to the next phase or production and/or operations is one aspect of project closure. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Transfer the intra-network to operations.
Celebrate with the team.
Inform the suppliers officially that the project has been completed.
Inform functional managers that the resources assigned to the project are now available to be assigned to any other project.

text: You are managing a four-phase construction project. The customer has formally accepted the deliverable of the first phase and the first phase gate has been reached. You and the key stakeholders want to make sure that the phase has met its success criteria and whether you can proceed to the next phase or not. What are the required documents in this situation?
explanation: When closing the project or phase , the project manager reviews the project management plan to ensure that all project work is completed and that the project has met its objectives. A phase gate is also a review point at the end of a phase to determine if the project will continue to the next phase, end the project, repeat the phase, or continue with some modifications. The documents required to make this determination are the project charter, the project management plan, the business case, and the benefits management plan. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Lessons learned register
Risk register and risk report
Contracts, procurement documents and project status report
Project charter, business documents and project management plan.

text: A new team member asks the project manager about the correct order of actions that will be taken during the Close Project or Phase process. What would be his answer?
explanation: You will need your team members help during documenting lessons learned, so you can't release them before documenting lessons learned. the last thing you do on the project is close the contract. The reason for this is that you don’t want to have to wait for payment before releasing the team, because most contracts have payment terms that allow for some period of time before full payment is required. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Obtain formal acceptance, release the team members, document lessons learned, close the contract
Document lessons learned, release the team members, obtain formal acceptance, close the contract
Obtain formal acceptance, document lessons learned, release the team members, close the contract
Obtain formal acceptance, close the contract, document lessons learned, release the team members

text: During executing your first project, your customer has terminated your project before it is complete. Which of the following statements is true?
explanation: Even if a project is terminated before the work is completed, you still need to document the lessons learned and update the OPA. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 47

choices.text: You must stop all work and release the team immediately.
You must work with the team to document the lessons learned.
You must keep the team working on the project to give your senior management time to talk to the customer.
You should give your team a vacation till you discuss with the customer.

text: A project manager facilitates a discussion with the team about experimenting with some agile practices in their plan-driven project. The team has been working on traditional projects for years and have never used any agile practices before. The project manager suggests using product reviews. One of the team members asks him about iteration reviews "is it similar to any traditional process?". Which process should the project manager mention in his answer?
explanation: Product review is similar to the Validate Scope process as the team obtains a stakeholder's acceptance for a project deliverable.
