You are planning the project with the project team when a key stakeholder suggests a different type of tree to be used for landscaping. The suggested type of tree is different from the one specified in the project scope. You and the project team agree that the suggested type is better and cheaper than the previous type as it will not affect the project schedule, but it will save $30,000 from project costs. You decide to use the new type of trees. What should you do first?
explanation: You are still planning your project, so the project is still not baselined. Before the baselines are established, changes are not required to be formally controlled by the Perform Integrated Change Control process. Impacts have already been evaluated as the new change will not affect the project schedule but it will decrease project costs. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Create a change request.
Evaluate impacts of using the new type.
Change the scope baseline and cost baseline to use the new type.
Consult the Change Control Board.

text: How should you plan for change management in a predictive environment?
explanation: Change is inevitable, so planning for change must be through a change management plan or a group of management plans where change management for each knowledge area can be performed separately. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 88.

choices.text: Changes are generally not predictable, therefore planning for change management cannot be reasonable.
Planning for change management should be done while the various change control processes are being applied.
Change management can be planned in a set of management plans or a specific change management plan.
Changes are a sign of poor planning. One should avoid changes during a project, thus eliminating the need to manage them.

text: Which of the following Agile Manifesto principles is closely related to backlog refinement?
explanation: As expressed in Agile Manifesto Principle 2, staying flexible to meet the customer’s changing business needs is fundamental to agile, and the backlog is one of the key ways that agile teams ensure this adaptability. The backlog is always evolving, and it needs to be kept continually updated with the latest requirements and new information. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide Page 8 and 52.

choices.text: Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project.
Continuous attention to technical excellence and good design enhances agility.
Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage.
Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely.

text: An organization has adopted an agile approach recently for a new project. The project sponsor directs their project manager, who has been assigned as a team facilitator, to add a new high-priority feature to the product. How should the project manager handle this scope change?
explanation: It is the ultimate responsibility of the product owner to manage and prioritize the product backlog. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide Page 52.

choices.text: The project manager should add the new feature to the product backlog and make it the top priority.
On an agile project, changes are welcomed at any time, so this feature should be assigned to the team for development.
Communicate the new feature request to the product owner to be considered in the next backlog session.
Tell the sponsor to talk with the product owner about this feature, reminding them that the product owner has authority to prioritize features.

text: After a great deal of effort, finally, the project manager has made a change to the scope baseline. What should he do next?
explanation: As the change is already made, this means that the impacts were evaluated, the change was submitted to CCB and approved. The remaining action is to update the project management plan and project documents to reflect the change. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Ask the sponsor to approve the change.
Evaluate impacts on other constraints like time, cost, and resources.
Revise the project management plan and project documents.
Send the change request to the Change Control Board.

text: During project execution which adopts a predictive life cycle, the customer has requested a change to the project scope which may affect other constraints. The project manager called for a meeting for the project team to discuss how to make this change. This is an example of:
explanation: This situation indicates a lack of a change management plan which describes the procedures required to make a change. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 88.

choices.text: Lack of a clear project scope statement.
Lack of a change management plan.
Lack of a communications management plan.
Good team relations.

text: You are a project manager on a construction project. When you planned the project, your enterprise environmental factors included a policy that all changes that cost over 2% of the budget need to be approved by the CEO, but smaller changes could be paid for by a management contingency fund. One of your stakeholders submitted a change request that requires a 3% increase in the budget. Your company has an outsourcing effort, and you believe that a small change to the way that the change is requested could allow you to take advantage of it and cut your costs in half. What is the best way to handle this situation?
explanation: As the company you work for has policies and procedures, you must follow them. Here the change requires a 3% increase in budget, so as per the company policy, you should request approval from the company CEO. When a stakeholder submitted the change request, this means that the change request is documented. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 83 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Work with the stakeholder to figure out how to reduce the cost of the change.
Request approval from the CEO.
Refuse the change because it is over 2% of the budget.
Document the change request, since all changes must be documented.

text: Which of the following activities is closely related to Agile Principle 2: "Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage"?
explanation: As expressed in Agile Manifesto Principle 2, staying flexible to meet the customer’s changing business needs is fundamental to agile, and the backlog is one of the key ways that agile teams ensure this adaptability. The backlog is always evolving, and it needs to be kept continually updated with the latest requirements and new information. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide Page 8.

choices.text: Limiting WIP
Grooming the backlog
Frequent verification and validation
Minimizing waste

text: All of the following are against Agile Principle Number Two "Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage", except:
explanation: As expressed in Agile Manifesto Principle 2, staying flexible to meet the customer’s changing business needs is fundamental to agile, and the backlog is one of the key ways that agile teams ensure this adaptability. The backlog is always evolving, and it needs to be kept continually updated with the latest requirements and new information. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide Page 8.

choices.text: Change Control Board
Scope creep
Scope variance
Backlog refinement

text: Frank is managing a major mechanical project using a predictive approach. The customer requested a change to the schedule baseline. Frank has determined the effect on the scope and cost, performed integrated change control, and adjusted the project baselines, the project management plan, and project documents. What should he do next?
explanation: The change has already been evaluated and approved; the next step is to inform stakeholders affected by the change. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Look for impacts to quality.
Submit the change to the Change Control Board for approval.
Look for other changes from the stakeholders.
Notify stakeholders affected by the change.

text: A key stakeholder has approached the project team who are working on a software project with a concern. He needs to add a new feature to the existing code. This code should be delivered within one week. The same stakeholder keeps chasing the project team with many requests during the past two weeks. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: First things first, he should follow the change control process as his requirement might have an impact on any of the project constraints. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: The team should analyze the impact of his new feature.
The team should ask the stakeholder to raise a change request.
The team should escalate the key stakeholder first to the project sponsor.
He is a key stakeholder, so his requirements should be applied.

text: During discussing the project status with some stakeholders in the weekly project status meeting, the project manager realizes that he should add two new risks to the risk register, four new requirements to the requirements documentation and requirements traceability matrix, and three new stakeholders to the stakeholder register. Does he need formal approval from the sponsor or others to change these?
explanation: The risk register, requirements documentation, and stakeholder register are all project documents; they are not part of the project management plan. Project documents are created by the project manager for his own needs to help him in managing his project. They don't require a formal change request to update them. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 89 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Yes. All documents require formal approval of changes by management.
It depends on what changes are being made.
Yes. The change needs to go through the Change Control Board for approval.
No. These are part of project documents, not the project management plan.

text: Martha is a scrum master for a product development project. Midway during a sprint, the customer representative has approached her to add a new, complex, and urgent safety-related requirement to the current sprint. The new requirement can't be postponed to another sprint. What is Martha's best response?
explanation: Normally, changes should not happen during a sprint for the current items in the sprint backlog. However, under unusual conditions, scope may be re-negotiated between the product owner and the team even if the sprint may be cancelled. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 55.

choices.text: Inform the customer representative that the sprint has already started and we can't add new requirements to the current sprint.
Add the new requirement to the product backlog, so that the product owner can give it the highest priority to be added to the next sprint.
Add the new requirement to the sprint backlog and if needed, the team can move a low-priority requirement back to the product backlog.
Discuss the new requirement with the product owner, who may cancel the current sprint.

choices.text: He should remind the project manager that the cost-benefit analysis for the project was done during project planning.
The project manager should do this report himself as a part of his job.
The team member should do what was asked because this sort of information must be given to the project sponsor to make the change.

text: You have been assigned as a project manager for a large project to develop an accounting system using a predictive life cycle. The project is expected to be finished in 6 months and is budgeted at $100,000. During project execution, you discover that some requirements have not been included in the project scope. Failure to meet these requirements may result in legal actions from the customer of the project against your company. However, implementing these requirements may increase the project schedule and budget. What should you do?

Do nothing, these requirements are not a part of the project scope.
This is scope creep; these requirements must be ignored.
Request additional funds and time to implement these requirements.

text: You are a project manager for a minor software project which is being developed using a waterfall approach. Your customer is requiring a minor change in project scope and expects you to do this without delays and additional costs. You believe that you have adequate authorization to make the decision by yourself, but you are not quite sure. What should be your next steps?
explanation: Whenever a change request may impact any of the project's baselines, a formal integrated change control process is always required. Every documented change needs to be approved or rejected by the Change Control Board (CCB) through the Perform Integrated Change Control process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: It is a minor change; you can approve it to increase customer satisfaction.
You can use the management reserve to accommodate for this minor change.
You can use the requested change to increase the profit from the contract.
Handle the request according to the integrated change control processes described in your project management plan.

The remaining action is to update the project management plan and project documents to reflect the change. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Ask the sponsor to approve the change.
Evaluate impacts on other constraints like time, cost, and resources.
Revise the project management plan and project documents.
Send the change request to the Change Control Board.

text: During executing a major telecommunication project, a hardware seller has released a major upgrade for some of the equipment being installed. The upgrade would provide the customer with functionality they requested at the beginning of the project, which was not available at that time. What should you do?
explanation: As a part of professional and social responsibility, you should care about the customer's interests, so you should tell him about the available upgrades, so ignoring the upgrade and continuing as planned is not the best solution. Implementing the change can't be done unless a formal change request is submitted and approved by the CCB. Implementing the change on the remaining installations can't be done unless a formal change request is submitted and approved by the CCB. So the best answer is to inform the customer about the available upgrade and its impacts on schedule and performance. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Implement the change and adjust the schedule as necessary because this supports the customer’s original request.
Inform the customer of the available upgrade and the impacts to the project’s timeline and functionality if the upgrade is implemented.
Continue as planned. Your customer didn’t request a change.
Implement the change on the remaining installations and continue with the schedule.

text: Which of the following activities is closely related to Agile Principle 2: "Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage"?
explanation: As expressed in Agile Manifesto Principle 2, staying flexible to meet the customer’s changing business needs is fundamental to agile, and the backlog is one of the key ways that agile teams ensure this adaptability. The backlog is always evolving, and it needs to be kept continually updated with the latest requirements and new information. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide Page 8 and 52.

choices.text: Limiting WIP
Grooming the backlog
Frequent verification and validation
Minimizing waste

text: You are managing a project with 34 team members and 7 key stakeholders. One team member identifies a problem with the current approach. To solve that problem you need to make changes to the project plan and its subsidiary plans. The project is time-sensitive and the customer previously indicated that any delays are unacceptable, and your team members tell you that the change may cause the team to miss at least one critical deadline. What is the best way to deal with this situation?
explanation: You must first evaluate the impact of change on all constraints. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Analyze the impact that the change will have on the work to be done, the schedule, and the budget.
Don’t make the change because any delays are unacceptable.
Ask the sponsor for guidance.
Make the change as soon as possible to the project plan and subsidiary plans, and ask the team to implement the change.

text: Frank is managing a major mechanical project using a predictive approach. The customer requested a change to the schedule baseline. Frank has determined the effect on the scope and cost, performed integrated change control, and adjusted the project baselines, the project management plan, and project documents. What should he do next?
explanation: The change has already been evaluated and approved; the next step is to inform stakeholders affected by the change. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Look for impacts to quality.
Submit the change to the Change Control Board for approval.
Look for other changes from the stakeholders.
Notify stakeholders affected by the change.

text: During executing a mechanical project using waterfall approach, an experienced engineer calls the project manager in private and informs him that there is a simpler design which is more fuel-efficient and it could achieve great cost saving. What should the project manager do?
explanation: It is not the responsibility of the engineer to evaluate impacts of the change on project constraints. A change request should be raised with the engineer suggestion for the new design and it will be assessed and approved or rejected by change control board. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66

choices.text: Do nothing, the plan has already been approved including the old design.
Ask the engineer to submit a change request.
Ask the engineer to evaluate the impacts on other project constraints.
Hold a meeting with the engineer and the designer of the old system to discover variances.

text: How should you plan for change management in a predictive environment?
explanation: Change is inevitable, so planning for change must be through a change management plan or a group of management plans where change management for each knowledge area can be performed separately. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 88.

choices.text: Changes are generally not predictable, therefore planning for change management cannot be reasonable.
Planning for change management should be done while the various change control processes are being applied.
Change management can be planned in a set of management plans or a specific change management plan.
Changes are a sign of poor planning. One should avoid changes during a project, thus eliminating the need to manage them.

text: During product demonstration, the team presents the product increment to the stakeholders. The customer requests some new features to be added. Which of the following is the best course of action? (1) The team should analyze the impact of adding the new features. (2) Add the new features to the next iteration. (3) Submit a change request. (4) Ask the customer about the priority of the new features. (5) The product owner should maintain the product backlog.
explanation: As the team completes the features usually in the form of user stories, the team periodically demonstrates the working product. The product owner sees the demonstration and accepts or declines stories. If the stakeholders want to add new features, they should clarify their priorities and accordingly the product owner will add them to the product backlog. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 55.

choices.text: All of them.

text: What does the Agile Manifesto value "responding to change over following a plan" mean?
explanation: Instead of investing effort in trying to bring the project back in line with the original plan, we want to spend more of our effort and energy responding to the changes that will arise. It doesn’t mean we should not do any planning and just react to changes. We still need to plan, but we also need to acknowledge that our initial plans were made when we knew least about the project (at the beginning) and will need to be updated as the work progresses. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide Page 8 and 20.

choices.text: Agile projects don't need intense planning, so change requests are more important as they represent customer inputs.
The project team commits to the initially developed plan, however any change request to the project plan can be approved or rejected.
In agile projects, initial planning is done when we know the least about the project and this plan may be updated as the work progresses.
In agile projects, the project team spends less time in planning and approves more change requests than traditional projects.

text: Samuel is managing an industrial project in a predictive environment. The project execution is almost complete and the project team prepares for the handover of the final product. The project sponsor informs Samuel that an important feature is missing in the product and the product will not be accepted without this feature. In light of this, what is the first thing that Samuel should do?
explanation: It is a scope change but it will happen late in the project life cycle. The project manager needs to assess the impacts first. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Handover the product and start project closure procedures.
Assess the impacts of adding the new requirement on the project.
Inform the project sponsor that it is not possible to add a new requirement just before handover.
Hold a meeting with the team and discuss all available options.

text: You are a project manager for a product development project which uses a traditional life cycle. A team member approaches you with a change that could cut your schedule down by one week and the change is easy to make. What is the first thing you should do?
explanation: Review change control procedures; you must first evaluate the impacts of the change on all constraints. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 66.

choices.text: Write up a change request and submit it to the Change Control Board.
Make the change; it’s going to save time and nobody will want the project to take longer than it should.
Figure out the impact on the scope of the work and the cost before you write up the change request.
Tell the team member that you’ve already communicated the deadline for the project, so you can’t make any changes now.

text: A new organization has implemented few projects and outcomes were successfully delivered to the customers. The organization's PMO wants to evaluate the degree of customers' satisfaction with the products and the projects and whether those customers are willing to recommend a product or service to others. Which of the following metrics can they use?
explanation: A Net Promoter Score measures the degree to which a stakeholder is willing to recommend a product or service to others. It is true that turnover and mood chart are metrics that can be used to measure stakeholders satisfaction, but they can't be used to measure the degree to which a stakeholder is willing to recommend a product or service to others. They are more suitable for internal stakeholders.

choices.text: Mood Chart
NPS
Turnover
NPV

text: Pedro has just been promoted to a project manager position in his organization and he is getting ready to manage his first project. He has been given approved project charter. What is the first thing he should do?
explanation: After issuing the project charter, the project manager must determine which stakeholders have participated in the high level scope. Identify Stakeholders is an initiating process, other processes are planning processes. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 508 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 11-12

choices.text: Create a project scope statement
Confirm which stakeholders had input to the scope
Begin working on a project management plan
Start collecting requirements from stakeholders

text: Which of the following Agile Manifesto principles is more related to Working Collaboratively?
explanation: The Agile Manifesto highlights stakeholder collaboration in its fourth principle “Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project”. By working with business representatives daily, we can learn about the business in a way that is far beyond what a collection of requirements-gathering meetings can ever achieve. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 8 and 35

choices.text: Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project.
Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage.
Simplicity—the art of maximizing the amount of work not done—is essential.
Deliver working software frequently, from a couple of weeks to a couple of months, with a preference to the shorter timescale.

text: The intrinsic motivators include all of the following, except:
explanation: There are three types of intrinsic motivators: autonomy, mastery, and purpose. Salary and rewards are extrinsic motivators. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 159

choices.text: Autonomy
Mastery
Purpose
Rewards

text: The sixth principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: "The most efficient and effective method of conveying information to and within a development team is face-to-face conversation". Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: Face-to-face communication allows individuals to quickly transfer alot of information in a richer way that includes emotions and body language. Teams use standups to microcommit to each other, uncover problems, and ensure the work flows smoothly through the team. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 53 and 80

choices.text: Daily Standups
Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Self-organizing teams
Timeboxing

text: Which of the following is the highest richness communication channels that a project team can use to transfer a broad spectrum of information and why?
explanation: Richness in communication allows a broad spectrum of information to be conveyed rapidly. Face-to-face communication is the richest communication channel. It is used to transfer the most information in a given period of time. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 157

choices.text: Videoconferencing, because it allows distributed stakeholders to communicate as if they are co-located.
Face-to-face, because it is used to transfer the most information in a given period of time.
Instant messaging, because it allows stakeholders to communicate urgent information immediately regardless they are co-located or not.
Emails, because it keeps record of all sent and received messages if they are needed later in the project.

text: According to Alistair Cockburn's Communication Effectiveness model, which of the following is the correct order from highest to lowest for richness of communication channels?
explanation: The richness of different communication channels from lowest to highest is paper, email, audio recording, video recording, IM, phone, face-to-face. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 157

choices.text: Phone, instant messaging, audio recording, paper
Face-to-face, phone, video recording, instant messaging
Face-to-face, video recording, paper, email
Face-to-face, audio recording, phone, paper

text: A project team is having a weekly meeting. This team meeting during project executing is the best format to :
explanation: Meetings -by definition - is a communication tool. There are other methods to know the project status like sending status reports for example. There are also other methods to make changes to the project and to making team building activities. The project team should use meetings for effective communication. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 376 and 381

choices.text: Determine project status
Make team building activities
Make changes to the project
Communicate

text: A project manager is concerned about sending progress reports. Another project manager advised him that he should also watch what is going on in his project, ask about problems, and help team members. Which of the following is the biggest disadvantage of progress reports as compared to watching what is going on in a project, asking questions, and assisting team members?
explanation: Sending progress reports is important, but not like effective project management like watching what is happening, asking about problems and helping team members. Usually project reports are sent one or two weeks later after performing actual work, so reports shows problems after they have occurred. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 385 and 392

choices.text: Progress reports supply information about trends.
Progress reports are not detailed enough.
Progress reports require expending time gathering information from stakeholders.
Progress reports generally show problems after they have occurred.

text: You are managing an accounting project when a new financial manager is hired at your company. He will be affected by all accounting projects in your company. What’s the best thing for you to do?
explanation: The manager is affected by your project, that means he’s a stakeholder, so you should get the new stakeholder’s opinion incorporated in the project. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 11

choices.text: Show him the project charter so that he knows that you are in charge of the project.
Work with him to understand the current requirements and determine if he has new ones to add to the project.
Do nothing.
Add him to the communications management plan.

text: Which form of communication is appropriate for a project manager to report the final status of the closed contract to the stakeholders?
explanation: These reports must be formal written. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Informal written
Informal verbal
Formal written
Formal verbal

text: A project has been initiated to build a new factory in a city. The project manager has obtained the necessary approvals and government permits for building the factory. When the project execution has started, it was found that the neighbours went to the location and object to building a factory in this location. What should the project manager do to move forward with the project?
explanation: Stakeholders are the people, groups, or organizations that could impact or be impacted by the project. Neighbours here are stakeholders who may impact the project negatively. They are resistant to the project. The project manager should discuss with them the project objectives, understand their requirements and try to increase their engagement level and move them from resistant stakeholders to neutral stakeholders. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 521 and The Standard for Project Management, Page 32

choices.text: Call the police.
Add a risk to the risk register for neighbours resistance and document its negative impact on the project progress.
Disregard the stakeholders requirements and continue building the factory.
Meet with the neighbours, explain the project objectives and discuss their requirements.

text: Which of the following statements best describes how stakeholders are involved on a project?
explanation: The project manager is the one who creates the project schedule not the stakeholders during the Develop Schedule process. The project manager determines the resource needs for the project during the Estimate Activity Resources process. The project sponsor issues the project charter and approves it, not the stakeholders. So the best answer is that the stakeholders help the project manager determine the project constraints and product deliverables. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 14

choices.text: They help to determine project constraints and product deliverables.
They help determine the project deliverables and project schedule.
They help to provide project assumptions and determine the resources needs on the project.
They create the project management plan and approve the project charter.

text: Scott is the project manager for a large and complex software project in his organization. The organization has only one web developer and he is assigned full time to this project. Maria is the IT manager, she needs to assign some functional work to the same resource. Maria is classified in this project according to the direction of influence as:
explanation: Sideward stakeholders are the peers of the project manager, such as other project managers or middle managers who are in competition for scarce project resources or who collaborate with the project manager in sharing resources or information. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 513

choices.text: Upward
Downward
Outward
Sideward

text: Which of the following theories focuses on motivating employees by creating a work-life balance?
explanation: Theory Z focuses on motivating employees by creating a job for life where the focus is on the well-being of employees and their families. This style of management seeks to promote high productivity, morale, and satisfaction. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Theory X
Theory Y
Theory Z
Theory of needs

text: Chris and Anne are two key stakeholders in a software project. They expressed their concern to the project manager that they are not updated with project changes. During last week change control board approved two change requests to the scope baseline and they were not updated. The project manager apologized to them and solved the problem by sending an automated notification email from the organization’s change control system whenever a change request is approved to the concerned stakeholders. Which document should be updated accordingly?
explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. It includes stakeholder communication requirements, information to be communicated and person or groups who will receive the information. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 79

choices.text: Stakeholder engagement plan
Communication management plan
Stakeholder register
Change management plan

text: George is the project manager for a large software project. He has impleemnetd an automated reporting system, so that all stakeholders can get their needed reports automatically at any time using the electronic reporting system. Stakeholders don't need to wait for any report to be sent. Later, he was contacted by Peter, a senior manager, who has asked him to send him the project status report using a template which has been used before implementing the new system. What should George do in this situation?
explanation: The senior manager may find his needed information in the new system, but he finds some difficulties that is why he requested from the project manager to send him the status report in the old format. The best solution is to contact the senior manager and know his requirements in details. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 367 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 11

choices.text: Modify the reporting system to include the project status report with the old template.
Send him the needed report with the needed template.
Contact Peter and ask him about his needs in details.
Grant Peter access to the new reporting system.

text: Pierre is managing a large software project which involves many stakeholders. His organization had a high turnover rate during the last year. To avoid the risks resulting from high turnover rate, he needs to measure the team members satisfaction. He decided to use mood chart. He informed the project team that at the end of each day, project team members can use emojis to indicate their frame of mind. What is a disadvantage of using mood chart that might affect these measures?
explanation: A mood chart can track the mood or reactions of a group of very important stakeholders—the project team. At the end of each day, project team members can use colors, numbers, or emojis to indicate their frame of mind. Tracking the project team’s mood or individual project team member’s moods can help to identify potential issues and areas for improvement to reduce turnover rate. Mood charts can be subjective. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 103

choices.text: Mood charts will not help to reduce turnover rate.
Mood charts will not help to identify potential team issues.
Mood charts does not measure the project team morale.
Mood charts can be subjective.

text: Sam has just taken over a project which is being executed using predictive approach. He has noticed that the project team members waste much time in responding to stakeholders questions and inquiries. Stakeholders usually interrupt the team members anywhere anytime which makes the team members unable to focus on project work. Which of the following should Sam do first?
explanation: Sam needs first to review the communications management plan to determine how stakeholder questions and inquiries should be managed. Then can judge whether the stakeholders are violating the plan or not. Then, he can make whatever changes that might be needed to shield the project team from wasting their time in responding to the stakeholders' questions. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 389 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Ask the team to better manage their time and dedicate a slot to answer stakeholders questions and inquiries.
Ask the stakeholders to formally address their questions to him.
Ask the team members not to respond to any stakeholders inquiries as this is not their responsibility.
Review the communication management plan and submit change request if needed.

text: Which of the following represents a win-win negotiation?
explanation: The buyer gets the work completed and the seller gets a reasonable profit is an example of win-win negotiation. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 167

choices.text: Fine, we agree on the price you asked for as you will provide the service we need with all mentioned specifications.
We will go with Sam's suggestion, all others are rejected.
Let's accept the less profit for now, this will give us an opportunity to penetrate this new market.
We will implement the first part of the approach proposed by Mike and the second part of the approach proposed by Julia.

text: What is the best method to report to the project team the status of the project schedule during project executing?
explanation: Bar Charts are the best method to report to project team, as they determine what has been achieved in the project. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 217

choices.text: Milestone chart
Network diagram
Activity list
Bar chart

text: Linda is managing a cyber security project for ABC company. During project executing, the customer representative has been changed. Few weeks later, the new representative complains that he is not aware that the project has fallen behind schedule because he did not receive any project status reports since he has been assigned. However, all other stakeholders are aware of the status. Usually, Linda share the project status at the end of each week via email. How should she address this situation?
explanation: It is clear that the stakeholder register and the communication management plan were not updated when the new representative joined the project, because all other stakeholders are aware of the project status except him. So, the best answer is to update the stakeholder register and the communication management plan with the new representative information and ask him if he has any other communication requirements. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 389, 508 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 11

choices.text: Update the stakeholder register and communication management plan and discuss the project requirements with the new representative.
Apologize to the new representative and send him the project status report.
Share the communication management plan with the new representative.
Update the list of recipients of the project status report email.

text: Chris has been assigned to manage a large software project using virtual team distributed in four countries. There are many internal and external stakeholders involved in this project. At the beginning of the project, Chris and the project team are developing a stakeholder engagement strategy to properly engage both internal and external stakeholders. Which of the following approaches should they follow?
explanation: The project manager and project team should develop and tailor appropriate management strategies for effectively engaging stakeholders in project decisions and execution. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 503 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 10

choices.text: Analyze all stakeholders and tailor an engagement strategy for each stakeholder.
Develop one engagement strategy for all stakeholders.
Arrange regular face to face meetings with both internal and external stakeholders.
Ask the project sponsor to take the responsibility of senior management engagement.

text: Which of the following represents a lose-lose negotiation?
explanation: Compromise entails that all parties will not be satisfied 100% and each has to give up something. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 168-169

choices.text: The project manager decides to give up on his own approach and use the approach provided by Mark in order to gain confidence.
The technical team negotiates different approaches and they will implement Phillip's approach rather than the approach provided by Mary.
The project manager has agreed with the two team members who are in a conflict to compromise.
The supplier succeeded in negotiation with the procurement manager to reach a fair and reasonable price for the service which he will provide.

text: Stephen and Ann are two stakeholders are discussing about the impact of the project on their departments. They both were not satisfied with the impacts. Stephen asked Ann if the project is on budget. Ann informed him that CPI is 1.03. Stephen and Ann agreed that they are not sure that the project manager knows their concerns. The project manager heard this conversation between them. What is the best thing he can do?
explanation: Directing any questions to the project manager in writing is not the best choice. Make a presentation to all the stakeholders regarding the status of the project is not a good solution because only two stakeholders have this problem. The issue log is the record where stakeholders' problems with the project are recorded, but here the project manager is unaware of the reservations of both stakeholders regarding the project. Consequently, using the issue log is not the best solution. It is better to arrange a meeting with both stakeholders to learn about their reservations.

choices.text: Send both stakeholders a copy of the issue log and ask for additional comments.
Ask both stakeholders to direct any questions to the project manager in writing.
Make a presentation to all the stakeholders regarding the status of the project.
Arrange a meeting with both stakeholders to allow them to voice any concerns they may have.

text: All of the following are stakeholders satisfaction measures, except:
explanation: Stakeholder satisfaction can be measured with surveys or by inferring satisfaction, or lack thereof, and by looking at related metrics, such as morale, net promoter score, mood chart and turnover. Throughput analysis assesses the number of items being completed in a fixed time frame. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 103

choices.text: Mood Chart
Net Promoter Score
Throughput analysis
Morale

text: Thomas is the finance manager in the organization and he is known to be an unsupportive stakeholder. He is a key stakeholder in the new IT project. Harold has been assigned as a project manager for this project. He held a meeting with Thomas to identify the preferred communication method, format, and content for planned communication activities. Which skill did Harold use?
explanation: Communication styles assessment is a technique used to assess communication styles and identify the preferred communication method, format, and content for planned communication activities. Often used with unsupportive stakeholders. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 375

choices.text: Communication styles assessment
Political awareness
Cultural awareness
Problem solving

text: During a weekly project status meeting, you ask one of the stakeholders if he reviewed the document you sent him last week. He said: “I’m not sure, I don’t know what you are talking about”. Which engagement level is this stakeholder displaying?
explanation: Here the situation indicates that the person doesn't know anything about his role and responsibility in the project, so he is unaware. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 521

choices.text: Unaware
Resistant
Supportive
Leading

text: You are an agile practitioner working on a product development project. A stakeholder asks you about the remaining features to be delivered. What should you do in this situation?
explanation: Information radiators are usually displayed in high-traffic areas to maximize exposure,where they can quickly inform stakeholders about the project’s status. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 108

choices.text: Ask him to contact the product owner.
Send him the burndown chart.
Guide him to the information radiator.
Apologize to him and send a detailed report about the project status including remaining features to be delivered.

text: Net Promoter Score can be used to measure:
explanation: A Net Promoter Score measures the degree to which a stakeholder is willing to recommend a product or service to others. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 103

choices.text: Stakeholders Satisfaction
Business Value
Deviation from Baselines
Deliverables Attributes

text: Tom is the sponsor of a large construction project. He is meeting with all the stakeholders to ask for their participation and support in the next testing events. How would you best describe his level of engagement?
explanation: Here Tom is trying to increase stakeholders engagement, so he has a leading role. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 521

choices.text: Unaware
Resistant
Supportive
Leading

text: Peter is a project manager for a tele-communication project in a multinational company. The project team members are located in three countries with different time zones. As per the communications management plan, the project team has a weekly status meeting through videoconferencing. Which communication method are they using?
explanation: Interactive communication is between two or more parties performing a multidirectional exchange of information in real time. It employs communications artifacts such as meetings, phone calls, instant messaging, some forms of social media, and videoconferencing. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Push communication
Pull communication
Formal communication
Interactive communication

text: During weekly project status meeting, the project stakeholders keep asking questions like "what is the current status of the project?", "are we ahead or behind schedule?", "Did we miss this milestone or not?",..etc. What is the most probable reason for these questions?
explanation: In case of lack of visibility and understanding of project progress, check to ensure appropriate measures are being collected, analyzed, shared, and discussed during team and stakeholder meetings; validate agreement with the measures within the team and with stakeholders. The project team is not using the preferred communication method for project stakeholders has low probability, because this issue happened with many stakeholders. Having no communication management plan has low probability, because there is a weekly status meeting which is being determined and scheduled as part of the communication management plan. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 151

choices.text: Appropriate measures are not being collected, analyzed, shared or discussed during team and stakeholder meetings.
The project stakeholders don't read the project status report before the project status meeting.
The project team don't use the preferred communication method for project stakeholders.
There is no communication management plan in place.

text: You are a project manager for a large software project in a multinational organizai­on. Your project consists of 370 stakeholders located in three countries. In the middle of the project, the customer has requested a change to the project scope. You have evaluated the impacts of the change and found that it will add one week to the project critical path and 3,000$ to the project budget. You want to document the impacts of the change. Which communications method would you use in this situation?
explanation: Here you are dealing with large and international audience, so pull communication is more effective. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Push communication
Pull communication
Verbal communication
Interactive communication

text: The project team working on a construction project noticed that stakeholders are not engaged enough and they only share negative feedback about the project. However, the project team usually communicates with stakeholders. All of the following might be reasons behind this issue, except:
explanation: Evaluate whether sufficient information is being shared with stakeholders; feedback loops are present and working; and deeper engagement may work better than simply communicating. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 151

choices.text: Insufficient information is being shared with stakeholders.
All stakeholders contributed in creating the project management plan.
Feedback loops are not present or not working.
The project team don't engage deeper with stakeholders.

text: All of the following are examples of motivation models that can be used by the project manager to understanding what motivates project team members and other stakeholders, except:
explanation: Motivation models include theory X, theory Y, and theory Z, hygiene factors, theory of needs and intrinsic and extrinsic motivation. Drexler/Sibbet is a team performance model. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 167

choices.text: Theory X, Theory Y, and Theory Z
Drexler/Sibbet
Hygiene factors
Theory of needs

text: You are managing a multi-million dollars product development project which includes 350 stakeholders located in four countries. You are identifying stakeholders and analyzing their impact on your project to properly manage their engagement throughout the project life cycle. You noticed that there is a gap between current and desired engagement levels of a key stakeholder in the project. What is the best course of action in this situation?
explanation: The gap between current and desired for each stakeholder will direct the level of communications necessary to effectively engage the stakeholder. During planning for stakeholders engagement, you don't need to analyze why there is a gap between current and desired level of engagement, it is normal to find gaps according to the needs of the project. You are still at the beginning of the project and you have not done any effort yet to increase the level of engagement of stakeholders. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 12 and 13

choices.text: Increase the level of communications to effectively engage the stakeholder.
Submit a change request to the stakeholder engagement plan to effectively engage the stakeholder.
Change his location on the power/influence grid to high power/ high influence.
Try to understand why there is a gap between his current and desired level of engagement.

text: Patricia has been assigned to manage a large product development project. Midway through the project, she notices that many stakeholders ask her about the project status. She was asked from many stakeholders questions like "Are we on budget?", "Are we ahead or behind schedule?" and so on. She sends a weekly status report to a list of stakeholders. In light of this, what should she do?
explanation: There is a communication gap here. The project manager thinks that the project status report is sent to all relevant stakeholders. However, some stakeholders are missed. So the project manager should regularly assess the project communication effectiveness. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 389 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 14

choices.text: Assign a team member to address the stakeholders communication concerns.
Ask those stakeholders to check their emails.
Hold a weekly project status meeting with all stakeholders.
Update the list of recipients of the project status email.

text: Charles is the risk manager in the organization and at the same time he is the project sponsor for the new project. Laurence is the project manager of this project. In a critical risk, Laurence reaches out to Charles for guidance. This request is considered as:
explanation: Laurence consulted Charles because of his expertise in risk management. So, it is considered as expert judgement. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 369

choices.text: Project Communications
Project Reporting
Risk Identification
Expert Judgement

text: Ivan is the project manager for a new project to develop electronic tickets instead of paper tickets. He identified all stakeholders of the project and is analyzing the current and desired level of engagement for each stakeholder. Piere is trying to put obstacles in the way of project completion in order not to be fired from the organization. How should Ivan classify the engagement level of Piere?
explanation: Resistant stakeholder is aware of the project and potential impacts but resistant to any changes that may occur as a result of the work or outcomes of the project. These stakeholders will be unsupportive of the work or outcomes of the project. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 521 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 11–12

choices.text: Unaware
Resistant
Neutral
Supportive

text: You are managing a large tele-communication project. A senior manager has a great deal of authority regarding project decisions, however he does not have much interest in the project. In order to have a successful completion for your project, you will need continuous support from the senior manager in many project decisions. Which of the following engagement strategies should you use with the senior manager to keep him engaged?
explanation: According to the power/interest grid, the senior manager has high power and low interest. So the best engagement strategy is to keep him satisfied. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 512

choices.text: Manage him closely.
Keep him informed.
Keep him satisfied.
Monitor his actions.

text: The human resources department in an industrial company has just sent an email to all employees, just to inform them that next Monday is a vacation to all employees because of the country's national day. This is an example of:
explanation: Push communication is sent or distributed directly to specific recipients who need to receive the information. This ensures that the information is distributed but does not ensure that it actually reached or was understood by the intended audience. Push communications artifacts include letters, memos, reports, emails, faxes, voice mails, blogs, and press releases. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th

choices.text: Interactive communications
Push communications
Pull communications
Verbal communications

text: Which of the following can be a result of not engaging stakeholders effectively?
explanation: Not engaging stakeholders effectively can lead to product recalls or loss of organizational or project reputation. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 12

choices.text: Stakeholder commitment
Project is completed on budget
Project is completed on time
Product recalls

text: What is the purpose of effective communication?
explanation: Communication occur throughout the project, not only during project executing. Project information should be provided in the correct format not just in writing. Information should be provided at the right time not as early as possible and with the intended impact. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 379

choices.text: Information is distributed in project executing, in the requested format, to the right recipients.
Information is in the right format, sent as early as possible, with the intended impact.
Information is provided, in writing, at the right time, to the right recipients.
Information is provided in the right format, at the right time, with the intended impact.

text: Many project team members requested from the project manager to send them the training material.The project manager has uploaded all the training material on the company's intranet to be accessible to all team members. This is an example of:
explanation: Pull communication. Used for large complex information sets, or for large audiences, and requires the recipients to access content at their own discretion subject to security procedures. These methods include web portals, intranet sites, e-learning, lessons learned databases, or knowledge repositories. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Interactive communications
Push communications
Pull communications
Formal communications

text: You are a project manager working on a project to move a call center to a new city. You include a representative from a transportation company as a stakeholder. The sponsor objects to such activities as unnecessary. The best response is to inform the sponsor that:
explanation: The transportation company representative is a stakeholder because he can negatively impact the project. So you need to communicate more with him to increase his engagement. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 8

choices.text: The transportation company representative is a stakeholder since the call center will be in his city.
The transportation company representative is a stakeholder because he will be a customer for the call center.
The transportation company representative knows the call center needs better than either of us.
The transportation company representative can negatively impact the project.

text: The project manager assigned Mark to send a weekly email update to the project key stakeholders to explain the status of the project. Which communication method does this email update represent?
explanation: Push communication is sent or distributed directly to specific recipients who need to receive the information. This ensures that the information is distributed but does not ensure that it actually reached or was understood by the intended audience. Push communications artifacts include letters, memos, reports, emails, faxes, voice mails, blogs, and press releases. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Push communication
Pull communication
Formal communication
Interactive communication

text: Why does Agile Manifesto value individuals and interactions over processes and tools?
explanation: While processes and tools will likely be necessary on our projects, we should try to focus the team’s attention on the individuals and interactions involved. This is because projects are undertaken by people, not tools, and problems get solved by people, not processes. Likewise, projects are accepted by people, scope is debated by people, and the definition of a successfully “done” project is negotiated by people. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 8

choices.text: Because agile projects don't need intense planning, so processes and tools don't have great importance.
Because normally processes and tools are less important for agile projects than people interactions.
Because processes and tools cannot help in successfully completing a project.
Because projects are undertaken by people, accepted by people, scope is debated by people, and the definition of “done” is negotiated by people.

text: Fred is managing a large software project with a virtual team. Several concerns have been raised from the project team that they are not engaged because of the collaboration tools that are being used in the project. Several team members have suggested to use other collaboration tools that are being used in other projects instead of the existing ones. In light of this, what should Fred do?
explanation: The best solution is to discuss with the team all the recommended tools and select the appropriate one.As the tool is being used in other projects in the organization, so it can be used in this project. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 362 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Ask the team to raise a formal change request.
Discuss this topic with the project team and select the appropriate tool.
Inform the team that they must use the existing collaboration tools as they are recommended by the organization.
Ask the team to immediately use the recommended tools.

text: During performing stakeholder analysis and collecting their expectations about the project, you should pay more attention to documenting quantifiable expectations. Which of the following expectations is quantifiable?
explanation: Requirements should be unambiguous (measurable and testable), All other choices can't be measured. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 147

choices.text: The project must improve stakeholder satisfaction.
The project should be high quality.
The project must achieve a 10% reduction in repair cost
The product of the project must be

text: Martin is managing a project for exploring for oil in a city in another country. Two weeks after starting the project work, he was informed that a police officer went to the work location and forced the workers to stop their work. He said that they received many complaints from the neighbors because of the noise and pollution resulting from using the drilling machines. explanation: The cause of the problem was concerning the early identification of neighbors as stakeholders and analyzing their level of influence on the project. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 8

choices.text: Martin didn't include neighbors in the communications management plan.

Neighbors and their influence levels on the project were not identified and analyzed at the beginning of the project.

text: Richard is a project manager for a very large software project. He is an experienced project manager, it is his fourth project managing virtual teams. His team consists of 245 persons located in three countries. So, he created a communication management plan and all the team members are strictly following the plan. During project executing, some team members need to know the current risk status, what are the current risks, closed risks and accepted risks. Which communication method would he use in this situation?
explanation: In this situation, it is better to use pull communication which is used for large audience and requires the recipients to access the communication content at their own discretion. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 13

choices.text: Push communication
Pull communication
Interactive Communication
Feedback

text: Which of the following Agile Manifesto principles is the most related to team empowerment?
explanation: Since the development team is such an important factor, agile methods promote empowered teams. People work better when they are given the autonomy to organize and plan their own work. Agile methods advocate freeing the team from the micromanagement. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 8 and 33

choices.text: The most efficient and effective method of conveying information to and within a development team is face-to-face conversation.
Build projects around motivated individuals. Give them the environment and support they need, and trust them to get the job done.
Working software is the primary measure of progress.
Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely.

text: The eighth principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: “Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely”. Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: Agile methods recognize the value of a sustainable pace that allows team members to maintain a work-life balance. Allowing the team to create their own team charter with team norms and values will help create an agile environment in which team members can work to the best of their ability as a team. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 50 and 80

choices.text: Backlog refinement
Continuous integration
Team charter
Iteration planning

text: The sponsor asks the developers in a scrum team to add a very important item to the current sprint. What should they do?
explanation: The team must inform the product owner first as he is responsible to prioritize items in the backlog. Domain = People.

choices.text: Add the item to the next sprint.
Inform other members of the scrum team so they can take decision.
Add the item to the current sprint.
Cancel the current sprint and start a new sprint including this item.

text: Albert is a project manager for a large project to develop electronic tickets for railroad stations instead of paper tickets. He is being mentored by Jim, an experienced project manager. Albert is discussing with Jim that the project is very large and he needs to delgate some work to specialists. Jim advised him that he can delgate some work to specialists but the accountability of _____ can't be delegated or transferred.
explanation: The accountability of Integration Management can't be delegated or transferred. The project manager is the one who combines the results of other Knowledge Areas and has the overall view of the project. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 72

choices.text: Schedule Management
Procurement Management
Integration Management
Quality Management

text: Diego has just joined a construction project as a design team leader instead of Roberto who has resigned from the organization. choices.text: Resource Breakdown Structure
Responsibility Assignment Matrix
RACI chart
Text-oriented formats

choices.text: The product owner
The developers
The scrum team

text: Who should know the most about the progress toward a business objective or a release in a scrum team?
explanation: The product owner is responsible for ordering the product backlog and making it visible and transparent to all stakeholders. So, he knows most about the progress toward business objectives. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: The project sponsor
The scrum master
The product owner
The developers

text: Midway through the iteration, a major organization change is about to take place and the team members don't have a clear vision about the future direction of the product. The team members feel that the iteration should be placed on hold till more clarity about the future of the product emerges. Who should take this decision?
explanation: The product owner is the one who has the authority to cancel the iteration or put it on hold. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: The product owner
The agile coach
The team
The project sponsor

text: It has been noticed by the agile coach that the team is working extra hours in order to complete the current iteration. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: It is true that the team should maintain a constant pace, that's why they should commit only to what they can deliver according to the user stories sizes estimates and the team velocity. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 9

choices.text: The team should commit to complete less stories in the next iterations.

Recalculate the team velocity and move some user stories back to the product backlog.

text: The first value of the Agile Manifesto states that: "Agile teams value individuals and interactions over processes and tools". Which of the following agile techniques is closely related to this Agile Manifesto value?
explanation: While processes and tools will likely be necessary on our projects, we should try to focus the team's attention on the individuals and interactions involved. This is because projects are undertaken by people, not tools, and problems get solved by people, not processes. Agile Practice Guide, Page 97

choices.text: Information radiators
Team empowerment
Timeboxing
Delivery cadence

text: The project team is discussing the goals for the next iteration with the customer and product owner, then they will select the user stories they will commit to deliver as part of the next iteration. This behavior does comply with which agile principle?
explanation: As the team is self organized, it would be important for the team to discuss the goals for the next iteration with the customer and then select the user stories they will commit to deliver as part of the next iteration. choices.text: Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software.

text: Midway through the project, a conflict arises between the project manager and a team member. Resource management plan
Resource breakdown structure
RACI chart

text: During a retrospective the team dicusses the low velocity of the team during last iteration. choices.text: Problem solve

Reconcile

text: Two team members are arguing about the design of new network they are building. Confronting

text: The first principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: "Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software". Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: This principle includes three main points: The first is to satisfy the customer. The second point is early and continuous delivery. The final point is that what agile teams are delivering is valuable software (deliverable). Planning the project into releases and iterations with the highest value features to be delivered first allows early and continuous delivery. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide, Page 55 and 80

choices.text: Burndown chart
Information radiators
Daily standup
Iteration planning

text: A new project has been initiated in ABC organization. The project is risky as it will be delivered in a new market for the organization and the project team doesn't have experience with the product of the project. Some of the project team members want to spend more time to plan up front to reduce uncertainty, oversights, and rework. While some other team members find that the longer the time spent planning, the longer it takes to get a return on investment and the more market share could be lost. Which of the following represents the optimum amount of planning required for this project?
explanation: By taking more time to plan up front, many projects can reduce uncertainty, oversights, and rework. However, the longer the time spent planning, the longer it takes to get a return on investment and the more market share could be lost. The Barry Boehm model helps identify the optimum amount of planning, sometimes called the sweet spot. The sweet spot is different for every project (not standard); therefore, there is no correct answer for the right amount of planning overall. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 170

choices.text: The team should spend more time in planning to reduce uncertainty.
The team should not spend much time in up front planning in order not to lose market share.
There is a standard sweet spot for this type of project to help identify the optimum amount of planning.
There is no correct answer for the right amount of planning overall.

text: You are working with potential sponsors to determine which project your company will select from the following projects. Based on the benefit-to-cost (BCR) ratios Project A has a BCR of 5:2, Project B has a BCR of 5:3, Project C has a BCR of 3:1, and Project D has a BCR of 2:1. Which of the four projects should you recommend?
explanation: You should select the project with highest BCR. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 34 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 102

choices.text: Project A
Project B
Project C
Project D

text:
A business closes its offices after a major crisis, and everyone begins to work remotely. Many team members on one project team were high-performing contributors before the crisis. These team members are missing daily coordination meetings or attending meetings but turning their cameras off and not participating. The project is neither meeting iteration goals nor performing well. 
Which two actions can the project team take to get motivated again? (Choose 2)
explanation: When teamwork shifts from colocation to a virtual setting, we should expect engagement methods to change as well. The team should decide together on the best way to work and collaborate. Team engagement and work are situational, which is why teams should set their own ground rules together.

choices.text: Skip some daily coordination meetings to give people more time to work.
Revisit the team charter and ground rules.
Require team members who miss meetings or do not turn on their camera to explain their actions.
Discuss active engagement in the next sprint planning.
Discuss effective engagement and collaboration methods at the next retrospective.

text:
A virtual team member has recently joined a colocated team. Despite being highly qualified, the team member’s performance is constantly questioned and ridiculed by the colocated team members.
What should the project manager do next?
explanation: The project manager should empower this team to self-organize and address the risk of isolation and bullying the new virtual team member is experiencing. Using the team charter to address collaboration and team goals will remind everyone of the common goals of professionalism and appropriate conduct they seem to have forgotten.

choices.text: Review the team charter with the team, addressing collaboration, team performance, and positive ways of working.
Conduct a team-building event focused on improving interpersonal skills.
Organize a weekly virtual coworking session led by a facilitator.
Monitor the situation and intervene only if the virtual team member files a report with human resources (HR).

text:
An engineering specialist presents the latest test-driven development prototype for a product and asks for team feedback in a demo. A team member interrupts the demo to protest about the high cost of the prototype. Members of the engineering team immediately become defensive and start talking at the same time. 
What should the project manager do in this situation?
explanation: As an effective team lead you should know when people are behaving in ways that will have a negative effect on the team. In this case a team member is behaving like a bully, and the behavior threatens the stated purpose of the meeting. You should not respond by behaving like an authoritarian. Leaving the team to work out a problem might take a very long time and lead to even more emotional responses. If you can get the meeting back on track with a quick reminder this is the best option.

choices.text: Intervene and state the cost query will be considered but remind everyone that this demo is for product development feedback.
Stop the meeting, firmly tell everyone to calm down, and take control of the meeting.
Take the opportunity to address the team member’s concern during the meeting.
Allow the team to work through the disruption and problem on their own.

text:
A project team is completing an iteration. This team typically performs well under time pressure, but this time something seems different. The workrooms are quiet, and people are having conversations that seem secretive. A check of the scrum board shows that work is on schedule and quality checks have been met, yet the scrum master feels anxious.
What should the scrum master do next?
explanation: The Scrum Master has a responsibility to support the team by proactively identifying and removing impediments—even when issues are not immediately visible. The team's unusual behavior—quiet workrooms and secretive conversations—suggests a possible undercurrent of concern or disengagement that might not be reflected in metrics alone. Rather than making assumptions (A), putting people on the spot in a group setting (C), or centering emotions without context (D), the Scrum Master should reach out to team members individually. This will create a safe space for open dialogue and allow the Scrum Master to uncover any hidden issues or needs that may be affecting morale or performance.

choices.text: Assume everything is fine and let the team continue working.
Contact team members individually to help ensure they have what they need to get their work done.
Ask everyone to report how they think the sprint is going at the next daily scrum.
Tell the team you are feeling anxious about their work.

text:
A project team is being sent overseas to lead an integration project at a subsidiary factory. To prepare for the trip, the team reviews a transcript from the retrospective from a previous trip to identify the main problems.
Which problem can the team resolve by using servant leadership?
explanation: It is possible to understand why another team would be unwilling to do something and then seek a resolution. Use empathy and active listening to try to understand and inspire the host team by utilizing servant leadership. Scheduling problems, adverse weather, and incomplete training need practical, technical solutions.

choices.text: The host team is unwilling to partner in training exercises.
Host teams have dedicated nonworking hours during specific times of the day, leading to scheduling problems.
A heatwave during the site visit caused participants to complain about working conditions.
Equipment is poorly maintained because of ineffective training.

text:
A team lead is having a coaching session with a team member. Read the scenario and answer the question:
Lead: We've noticed your work is a few days late again.
Team Member: It is. I took extra time to fine-tune settings before handing it off to the release team.
